subject: Re: [junit] Re: OT: final
msgSnippet: ... Agreed, but after a one-week adjustment period, writing final became an unconscious action. It cost nothing. ... I don t think it s a question of
messageBody:
>So said Dave Astels on 2003-05-10 --------------------
>--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
>> Mike Bowler got me in the habit of using 'final' where possible, so
>> I asked him to read the article. Here is his response.
>
>
>> >My main reason for using final is to better explain my *intent* to
>> >the compiler.
>
>Should you be worried about the compiler? Shouldn't your focus be on
>expressing your intent to other programmers.

Agreed, but after a one-week adjustment period, writing 'final' became an unconscious action. It cost nothing.

>
>> > This gives the compiler the opportunity to....
>> >
>> >1) Provide better warning messages when I make a mistake
>
>
>> >2) Generate faster code
>
>This is a total non-issue... at kleast until it becomes an issue. You
>shouldn't be trying to outthink the compiler. See Bill Venner's
>interview with Martin Fowler at artima.com (the last part of it I think)

I don't think it's a question of out-thinking the compiler, but giving the compiler the tools to think better.

>> >The first is significantly more important to me than the second.
>
>Why? It's been a long time since I've even looked at compiler output.
>Eclipse pointes me at the problem. It's my test failure messages
>that are the critical thing.

Indeed. Perhaps after a while #1 becomes less of an issue.
